perturbation.original_text: PAYMENT TERMS All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text: PAYMENT TERMS All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment to the following individual below within 30 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by stating that the payment will be made within 30 days, while Clause 5 previously mentioned payment would occur within 7 days. This creates uncertainty about the enforcement of payment deadlines.

perturbation.original_text: AGREEMENT PERIOD This Agreement will be for the maximum period of six (6) months beginning for the commencement date, renewable in accordance with the terms hereof, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: AGREEMENT PERIOD This Agreement will be for the maximum period of twelve (12) months beginning for the commencement date, renewable in accordance with the terms hereof, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the original agreement period. The agreement initially states a maximum period of six months, but is now changed to twelve months, creating confusion and uncertainty about the actual duration of the contract. This is a clear contradiction regarding a key term.

perturbation.original_text: TERMINATION VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by giving two (2) weeks' notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by giving two (2) weeks' notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed. In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work done till date to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text: TERMINATION VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by giving two (2) weeks' notice in writing. If the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement with immediate effect by providing verbal notice to VAL. In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work done till date to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: The original termination clause requires the developer to provide two weeks' notice in writing, and states 'it is applicable only when the project is not completed'. This has been modified to enable immediate verbal termination and removes the 'project is not completed' limitation. This creates conflicting termination procedures and impacts the protection that the two week period might afford VAL. Verbal vs written notice is contradictory.
